Module jtrim.access
Package org.jtrim2.access

Class AccessProperties

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.access.AccessProperties
public final class AccessProperties extends Object
Defines static utility methods to track the availability of rights of an AccessManager as a PropertySource (with Boolean value).

Note that these properties are not intended for synchronization purposes but they can be used to enable and disable GUI components or change their state otherwise.

See Also:
  • org.jtrim2.property.swing.AutoDisplayState

  • Method Details

    • trackRequestAvailable

      public static <RightType> PropertySource<Boolean> trackRequestAvailable(AccessManager<?,? super RightType> accessManager, AccessRequest<?,? extends RightType> request)
      Returns a property which tracks if the given AccessRequest is available or not. That is, if it can be acquired or not from the specified AccessManager. The returned property is not intended to be used as a true synchronization utility, instead it can be used to change the state of GUI components based on the availability of rights.

      Note that listeners registered with the returned property are not necessarily invoked on the Event Dispatch Thread.

      Type Parameters:
      RightType - the type of the rights managed by the specified AccessManager
      Parameters:
      accessManager - the AccessManager managing the availability of rights. This argument cannot be null.
      request - the AccessRequest whose availability is to be tracked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks if the given read and write rights are available or not. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • trackReadRightsAvailable

      public static <RightType> PropertySource<Boolean> trackReadRightsAvailable(AccessManager<?,? super RightType> accessManager, Collection<? extends RightType> readRights)
      Returns a property which tracks if the given read rights are available or not. That is, if they can be acquired or not from the specified AccessManager. The returned property is not intended to be used as a true synchronization utility, instead it can be used to change the state of GUI components based on the availability of rights.

      Note that listeners registered with the returned property are not necessarily invoked on the Event Dispatch Thread.

      Type Parameters:
      RightType - the type of the rights managed by the specified AccessManager
      Parameters:
      accessManager - the AccessManager managing the availability of rights. This argument cannot be null.
      readRights - the rights requiring read access. This argument cannot be null (but can be an empty collection) and none of its elements is allowed to be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks if the given read rights are available or not. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      Returns a property which tracks if the given read right is available or not. That is, if it can be acquired or not from the specified AccessManager. The returned property is not intended to be used as a true synchronization utility, instead it can be used to change the state of GUI components based on the availability of rights.

      Note that listeners registered with the returned property are not necessarily invoked on the Event Dispatch Thread.

      Type Parameters:
      RightType - the type of the rights managed by the specified AccessManager
      Parameters:
      accessManager - the AccessManager managing the availability of rights. This argument cannot be null.
      readRight - the right requiring read access. This argument cannot be null
      Returns:
      a property which tracks if the given read right is available or not. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • trackRightsAvailable

      public static <RightType> PropertySource<Boolean> trackRightsAvailable(AccessManager<?,? super RightType> accessManager, Collection<? extends RightType> readRights, Collection<? extends RightType> writeRights)
      Returns a property which tracks if the given read and write rights are available or not. That is, if they can be acquired or not from the specified AccessManager. The returned property is not intended to be used as a true synchronization utility, instead it can be used to change the state of GUI components based on the availability of rights.

      Note that listeners registered with the returned property are not necessarily invoked on the Event Dispatch Thread.

      Type Parameters:
      RightType - the type of the rights managed by the specified AccessManager
      Parameters:
      accessManager - the AccessManager managing the availability of rights. This argument cannot be null.
      readRights - the rights requiring read access. This argument cannot be null (but can be an empty collection) and none of its elements is allowed to be null.
      writeRights - the rights requiring write access. This argument cannot be null (but can be an empty collection) and none of its elements is allowed to be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks if the given read and write rights are available or not. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null
